TopicTitle: KSP Featured In Guinness Book Of World Records

Articles.Content: Sure, it was the gaming edition, and it didn't actually win a record (it was a feature on science in gaming), but I saw it in a copy from the library and I was immediately awed. We must be getting famous! Unfortunately, I don't have a picture, but you can find it in any copy of the Guinness Gamer Edition 2014. Discuss!

Correct me if I'm wrong, but I'm pretty sure that danRosas handles all the publicity stuff etc. Obviously it would be taken to HarvesteR for approval, but Rowsdower could be kept completely out of the loop. Yeah, Rowsdower is the community manager, which is why you always see him posting anything to us. Basically, he's Squad's conduit between themselves and us (the consumers). I might be wrong, Rowsdower may market news about the game beyond the forums, but to my knowledge it's danRosas who handles all external stuff (with approval from HarvesteR). I'm kind of confusing myself here so this is a basic summary*:

  • Rowsdower: Community manager - he gives us all the news about Squad and Squad's products, as well as relaying back to them our opinions on them and anything we have to say about it. He also generally handles the community.
  • danRosas: Handles all marketing and anything involving Squad's products outside of Squad's domains (ie: outside of the forums, website, spaceport, etc.).
  • HarvestR: Final approval/judgement for danRosas/Rowsdower.

*From what I can assume. Don't take my word for this.

Rowsdower is indeed the Community Manager, and your description of his job is pretty accurate. DanRosas is the lead animator for KSP, so he's a developer. HarvesteR is the lead developer for KSP. More information about the people at Squad can be found here: https://kerbalspaceprogram.com/about.php
